summary: Email chain discussing a subpoena from the U.S. Virgin Islands Attorney General's Office to Deutsche Bank, seeking copies of government subpoenas and productions related to Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondence involves legal counsel coordinating with U.S. authorities about whether to share investigative materials.

persons.name: Parvin Daphne Moyne
persons.role: Attorney at Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP
persons.context: Legal counsel for Deutsche Bank, reaching out to U.S. authorities to seek permission to disclose subpoena and production materials related to Epstein to the U.S. Virgin Islands AG.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: His estate, executors, and others are defendants in a civil suit filed by the U.S. Virgin Islands AG, prompting the subpoena to Deutsche Bank.

persons.name: Joseph DiPiero
persons.context: Copied on the email from Parvin Moyne regarding the subpoena request.

persons.name: Thomas Moyer
persons.context: Addressed in the email from Parvin Moyne regarding the subpoena request from the U.S. Virgin Islands AG.

connections.description: Moyne is contacting Moyer, likely a U.S. authority, to seek permission for Deutsche Bank to comply with a third-party subpoena.
DiPiero is copied on the email from Moyne regarding the subpoena matter.

events.title: Subpoena from USVI AG to Deutsche Bank
events.description: The U.S. Virgin Islands Attorney General's Office issues a third-party subpoena to Deutsche Bank as part of a civil suit against Jeffrey Epstein's estate, seeking copies of government subpoenas and productions related to Epstein.

events.title: Email coordination on subpoena response
events.description: Email chain discusses whether to grant permission for Deutsche Bank to disclose subpoena and production materials to the U.S. Virgin Islands AG, noting the USVI AG is 'basically just trying to copy our investigation.'

keyFacts: The U.S. Virgin Islands Attorney General's Office filed a civil suit against Jeffrey Epstein's estate, its executors, and others.
Deutsche Bank received a third-party subpoena from the USVI AG seeking copies of any government subpoenas and productions related to Epstein.
Legal counsel for Deutsche Bank sought permission from U.S. authorities to disclose the subpoena and production materials to the USVI AG.
An email suggests the USVI AG's investigation is seen as attempting to replicate the existing U.S. investigation into Epstein.
